result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick S. McCain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick S. McCain is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patrick S. McCain was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay fine of $1500.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days (PD -Aileen Henry).
Not to unlawfully operate a motor vehicle.

supervisions.notes: Ignition interlock is to end the same time as the revocation.

Dated 03/25/16 - IT IS ORDERED that the appeal is dismissed.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 4-1/2yrs WSP; initial confinement of 18mos followed by 3yrs of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Credit for 133 days.  DL revoked for 24mos.  Ignition interlock ordered for 24mos.  PD's office to notify the court w/in 45 days of atty fees if reimbursement is requested.
